Markdown Tips

This is a collection of tips and information for writing with markdown.

Making Key Symbols

Because markdown can also accept html input, you can use the html keyboard tag to create key symbols:

<kbd>ESC</kbd>

makes the symbol: ESC.

Using Unicode Characters

You can specify unicode characters to be displayed in your Markdown document. You must know the numberical HTML code. This Page is my go-to reference for finding these. Be sure to select decimal under numerical HTML encoding of the Unicode character to get the correct code.

&#10230;

produces a right facing arrow or ‚ü∂
